Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
JavaFX controller class responsible for managing the game interface

The GuiController handles rendering of the game board, bricks, ghost bricks, notifications, score, timer, and control buttons It also manages keyboard iput and delegates gameplay actions to the InputEventListener (typically the GameController)

This class is linked to the FXML layout and initializes UI components such as panels, overlays, and labels

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiController

      public GuiController()
      Creates a new GuiController instance

      This constructor is invoked automatically by the JavaFX FXML loader when associated layout file is initialized

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the GUI controller after FXML loading

      Sets up fonts, keyboard input handling, notification layers, game over panel, and side bar buttons (pause, resume, exit, restart)

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • clearRow

      public void clearRow(ClearRow clearRow)
      Displays a notification when rows are cleared
      Parameters:
      clearRow - the ClearRow result containing cleared lines and score bonus

    • showNextBricksQueue

      public void showNextBricksQueue(List<Brick> nextBricksQueue)
      Displays the upcoming bricks queue in the preview panel
      Parameters:
      nextBricksQueue - the list of upcoming Brick objects

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the game view with the board matrix and active brick
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the current board state
      brick - the active ViewData brick

    • refreshBrick

      public void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the active brick rendering
      Parameters:
      brick - ViewData representing the current brick

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the background board rendering
      Parameters:
      board - the board matrix

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the event listener that handles gameplay input events

      The InputEventListener is typically implemented by the GameController, which processes user actions such as moving, rotating, holding, or dropping bricks This allows the GuiController to delegate input handling to the game logic

      Parameters:
      eventListener - the InputEventListener to receive and process input events

    • bindScore

      public void bindScore(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty integerProperty)
      Binds the score label to the given property
      Parameters:
      integerProperty - the score property

    • bindTimer

      public void bindTimer(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty secondsProperty)
      Binds the timer label to the given property
      Parameters:
      secondsProperty - the countdown property

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles game over state: stops timers, shows overlay, and displays final score

      Stops the active timeline, displays the game over overlay, shows the final score on the GameOverPanel, and marks the game as over

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Starts a new game by resetting the board, overlays and timers

      Hides the game over panel, resets pause state, and delegates to the InputEventListener to create a new game instance

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the triggering event

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Pauses the game by shifting focus back to the game panel

      This method does not alter timers or overlays directly, but ensures keyboard input remains focused on the game

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the triggering event

    • hardDrop

      public void hardDrop()
      Performs a hard drop of the active brick

      Continuosly moves the brick downward until it lands, refreshing the view at each step Updates the background and clears rows if necessary

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(Board board)
      Sets the active game board instance
      Parameters:
      board - the Board to associate with this controller

    • getHoldBrickPanel

      public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getHoldBrickPanel()

      the GridPane representing the hold brick panel

    • startCountdown

      public void startCountdown(int startSeconds)
      Starts a countdown timer for timed game mode

      Updated the remainingSecondsProperty every second and trigger gameOver() when the timer reaches zero

      Parameters:
      startSeconds - the starting time in seconds

    • getRemainingSecondsProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty getRemainingSecondsProperty()
      Returns the property representing the remaining countdown seconds
      Returns:
      the IntegerProperty for remaining seconds

    • resetTimer

      public void resetTimer()
      Resets the countdown timer to zero and stops it if running
